messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:34): zcorpan: needsinfo I created because under the current regime I don't officially have authority to move other editors' bugs to resolved
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:34): so I didn't want to move others' bugs to resolved and have somebody call process foul
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:44): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: want me to go through them and mark then NEEDSINFO?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:45): yeah, sure
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:45): if you have time
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:45): there's about 40 of them at this point, I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:45): so I seen you started marking up the spec with topic annotations
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:46): I think that'll be useful
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:46): yeah see whatwg mail
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:46): ah, ok
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:46): is at 295 unread in his inbox right now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): a few hours ago annevk was trying out that diff thing I suggested
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): for web-apps-tracker
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): and got it working
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:47): yeah i used that for this too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): ah cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): annevk got it working but ran into a problem caused by a side effect of it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:48): so hopefully he can figure out some way to get around that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:48): yeah we spoke about it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:48): ah, OK
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:50): http://lists.whatwg.org/htdig.cgi/whatwg-whatwg.org/2011-November/033946.html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): annevk: if you want me to include the affected topics in my html5.org ping, let me know
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:51): i should probably find a way to put them in the checkin comment, too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:51): finishes reading scrollback about the diff stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:52): didn't know about -x
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:52): AryehGregor: yeah, that use of "globalization" is misguided
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:53): that is what TC39 is calling their locales API
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:53): which I guess is probably the context for why you mentioned it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:54): it's kind of like when people started calling themselves "serial entrepreneurs"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:54): and now serial whatevers
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:55): when not just a few years ago the only context for using "serial" was in serial murderer or serial some-other-criminal-type

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:11): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: i tend to assume "attention grab" when people don't use the same word for something that the rest of living english-speaking humanity uses
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:12): yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:12): there is that too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:12): but I don't think they are consciously doing it for that reason
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:12): they are just naively saying, Hey, there's a word that sounds good
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:13): if people are implementing a localization framework who don't even know the word "localization", i'd be very worried
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:13): without taking time to consider how the word it normally used in practice and what negative connotations it might have
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:13): no, they know the word localization
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:13): I think it's that what they are producing is not strictly about localization
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): it's more about what normally called "locales" support
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): I guess
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): and it seems like until recently most everybody had been calling the JS thing "The Locales API"
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:32): locales is a standard part of localization
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:32): not to state too much the obvious :)
